page.title: 06EDUCATION
page.content: USK SCHOOL, AGRICULTURAL COLLEGE Usk College of Agriculture runs courses for male and female students (16 years and over). Some students are residential, other are day release students and on a Government Youth Training Scheme. The college runs its own farm including arable, dairy, sheep and pig farming. There are courses in Horticulture, Beekeeping, Home Economics and Farm Secretarial Work. There are tennis courts and a rugby pitch for students. Usk Primary and Junior School and Community Centre was opened in February 1985, when the local church school closed. Children, 7-11 years, local, and from the villages of Glascoed, Gwehelog, Llantrissant and Llangibby, where the schools have closed, are bussed in daily. The 11+ pupils have further education at the comprehensive school
